website_summaries.verdict: Unless you're prepared to spend a disproportionate amount of money on a really good lens, the resolution bump offered by the Sony Alpha DSLR-A350 isn't worth the price.
pros: useful Live View implementation with flip-up LCD

customer_reviews.title: Field tested in Europe!
customer_reviews.text: This Alpha 350K, did function very well, it was very handy and convenient to use the tilting screen, the responses are just fine, and I got used to the slow response when using the tilting screen. I was able to take shots over my head at times or over crowds! Also was able to take unusual angles! Also noted that the battery "metering"indicator show the drain/remaining charge, that it uses more battery with the tilting screen on.I carry an extra battery anyway. We took excellent images with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Tony PI

customer_reviews.title: Just add talent, and maybe a lens or two
customer_reviews.text: Great DSLR overall. Invest in a few high end lenses if you want more, but be careful not to blame the camera. The live view LCD has its own sensor, and you have to be careful not to judge the shot by what you see there. Battery life is great. Solid, professional feel, controls, weight, etc. Super camera that will give professional results to the amateur and ease of operation for the pro who can finally start to lighten his(her) bag.
customer_reviews.author: MACROADS

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for almost two years and I has been all over the world. Takes great pictures and has held up will being in boats and rough terrian from Japan, Philippines and Dubai. great camera.
customer_reviews.author: uglyluggage

customer_reviews.title: Review of camera, a Sony 350
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Very pleased. One problem, did not receive an instruction book for this camera, got another.Could use the correct one. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: John Robert Burns, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The one that seems to do it all
customer_reviews.text: Although I am still discovering features that are provided by the Sony, thus far I am very happy. Lots of megapixels and a standard lens that has a wider range in focal lengths than the competition.I decided on this particular camera because it will accomodate all of my lenses that were previously on my Minolta 7000i 35mm. Do not need to start over and absord the extra expense of additional lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Dana L. Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Photo taking with the Sony 350
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I have a 1970 Minolta SRT 101 35mm camera with wide angle and telephoto lens. I understood that I could use my lens from Minolta with this Sony A350. I found out this would not work. I found that I like the camera and the lens I bought. I am still learning how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronal E. Henley

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Camera works great and takes great pictures. I am an amateur, but I have been impressed with it's ease of use and the quality of pictures.
customer_reviews.author: BugaBoo

customer_reviews.title: great camera at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Sony sent me a promotion for Mother's day advertising the alpha series cameras. I checked the specifics on the camera and decided to get it for my wife. One of the best decisions I've made in a while. The camera is easy to use. All features work as advertised. Picture quality is best I've seen. I also have a Canon EOS 20D so I think I can speak from experience.
customer_reviews.author: George R. Almasi

customer_reviews.title: was good in its time, crappy today
customer_reviews.text: Old camera that takea outdated memory card and just isn't that useful in today's camera market. For cheaper than this I bought a brand new 2014, 20 megapixel Sony dslr HighbrId camera from best buy once I got my money back for the return of this camera
customer_reviews.author: Bill Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, regular zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful camera, but the lens not so good. I'm looking for a new lens to replace the original one.
customer_reviews.author: ÓSCAR ÁGREDO PIEDRAHÍTA - COLOMBIA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: My first DSLR and what a great camera! Being Sony I'm confident it's from a company on the cutting edge of technology. Every feature I've ever wanted and then some!
customer_reviews.author: David Dardar

customer_reviews.title: The Image Stabilization stops working..
customer_reviews.text: my Sony Alpha A350 worked great for years (about 5) until one day all pictures began being moved and out of focus, this problem was due to the Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization stop working, this sensor got moved for no reason, my camera never got hit or was dropped, I guess it moved thru all the years of operation, after some research, I found out this problem is common in all Sony Alpha series, fixing this sensor would cost @ $300.00, I prefer invest that money in a new camera... I give this camera 2 stars only for the good use I got from it while working, but this defect is not acceptable for a such expensive equipment...
customer_reviews.author: CAC.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent DSLR Camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: Be honest, how many people do print on images at the size A3? Great value for money. Easy to use. Perfect handling. Bright images. Good build. Neat in clean images. You don't need more Mb. Well, this lens is very light and versatile and also quite sharp stopped down, The standard lens 18/70mm is average. But goes futher than other standard lenses. but no match for the Tamron 17-50 f/ 2.8 or Tamron 28-75 f/ 2.8 or the Minolta 50mm very Good. Problems Sony Lenses are very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad M. Bajeaifir

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed by photo sharpness
customer_reviews.text: Please read all comments to this posting as I may add comments as I gain experience. I have taken photos with the A350 using both the 18-70 (f3.5 to 5.6) Sony lens and the 75-300 (f4.5 to 5.6) telephoto Sony lens. I shot pictures of a tree a few hundred feet away. I am surprised that non-SLR cameras show the leaves clearly, while the leaves are very blurry in my A350 photos, even after image stabilization turned on. I tried various f-stops and shutter speeds yet the results are disappointing. Anybody notice this? Does this imply the lenses are not "fast" enough?
customer_reviews.author: J. Shah

customer_reviews.title: Nice cam! Nice pics!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed A350 a lot. The image quality is very high. I shot some awesome family pictures, portraits, our vacation photos: everything came out superb. For an amateur as I am it is dream camera! I user DSC-R1 from Sony before and it also was terrific camera. If you aren't satisfied with the pics from this cam you need some real expensive lens and pro level equipment. I'm very happy with this DSLR!
customer_reviews.author: Noah  Lederer

customer_reviews.title: Best Live View in the world of DSLR!
customer_reviews.text: A350 was my first DSLR... I only buy it because of it's Quick AF Live View feature: Very Good, like a compact camera. I just don't use the viewfinder... I Don't like to put my eye directly on the camera !!! I bought a 100mm Macro Lens... but the photo quality is not what I've expected... maybe I need some time to improve my shots! The LCD is Bad in Outdoors... you just can't see anything - In comparison with Sony DSC-H9's LCD. No Trimming option on the menu is Bad!
customer_reviews.author: Valter Jacinto

customer_reviews.title: maybe you'll get a good one
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 350 from sony and either one or both of the 50mm and 28 mm fixed focus lenses on Amazon. Very unreliable auto focusing with both lenses. Trying to communicate with Sony to get repairs was very frustrating (almost as frustrating as with a cable/dish TV provider). Their "repaired" camera isn't. Printing a 24x36 poster from my Canon point-and-shoot is as good as one from the 350 and these lenses. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Minolta Lens
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Minolta zoom lens. It doesn't seem to work on the Sony A350. It zooms in; but, when the picture is focused to snap, it goes back to the regular view. Any ideas on what to do? The auto focus does not work with the Minolta lens at all---have to manually focus.
customer_reviews.author: camper

customer_reviews.title: Alpha 350 is great
customer_reviews.text: I never have had a camera where the settings were so accessible and intuitive as the Aloha 350. Picture quality is excellent. The camera is lighter than expected, but seems plenty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Irwin

product_meta.title: Sony Alpha DSLRA350K 14.2MP Digital SLR Camera with Super SteadyShot Image Stabilization DT 18-70mm f/3.5-5.6 Zoom Lens
product_meta.description: With incredible 14.2 MP detail, Sony¿s ¿ (alpha) DSLR-A350 raises the standard of excellence for step-up digital photographers shooting both family memories and fine-art photos. Live Preview in a large 2.7¿ LCD screen links you and your subject -- and you¿ll have special features like super-quick AF response, continuous shooting at 2 fps while you see your subject in the viewfinder, Creative Style modes for quick recall of custom settings, and in-camera Super SteadyShot image stabilization that reduces blur with every Sony, Carl Zeiss and legacy Minolta a-mount lens.
feature_bullets: Kit include DT 18-70mm f3.5-5.6 Standard Zoom Lens
Tiltable 2.7¿ LCD screen for high/low angle shots

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars42 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
